alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 03 at 7:58AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON CST /1 PM EST/ TODAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Alabama and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in southeast Alabama, Coffee, Dale and Henry. In southwest Georgia, Clay, Quitman and Randolph. * WHEN...From Noon CST /1 PM EST/ today through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Widespread 2-4" of rain is expected with isolated higher amounts within the watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
